title: Ticket #4399: Email from the collector may be sent to user named "none"
description:
If the config knob CONDOR_DEVELOPERS is left unset, and HTCondor is built with the compile-time cmake option -DNO_PHONE_HOME:BOOL=TRUE (which is currently done by several downstream distros like Red Hat, OSG, Fedora), email is still being sent to the user "NONE" on the machine where the collector runs. Good times. Obviously what is supposed to be happening is no email should be sent at all, in accordance with the documentation for config knob CONDOR_DEVELOPERS and the HTCondor privacy policy.

This bug was introduced with the introduction of the NO_PHONE_HOME compile-time flag in commit [20404].

Note this bug does not exist in the binaries distributed by UW-Madison, as UW does not set the NO_PHONE_HOME compile flag.
